Posted By: syrazemyla (1/7/2012 4:26:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I would like to jump into the this vs. [Mob Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mob Justice) debate.  
  
First, they have slight but important differences to each other, and I can see situations where they would both be useful. That being said [Mob Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mob Justice) is the better card.   
  
Sure, this targets creatures and players, but you have to choose a creature type and it costs 4 mana. For 4 mana in red you can do much better than this. [Mob Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mob Justice) costs half and doesn't care about the creature type. In practice MJ can do a fair amount of justice, especially if you imprint it on an [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter) and throw some token generators out there.
posts.html:
I would like to jump into the this vs. Mob Justice debate.

First, they have slight but important differences to each other, and I can see situations where they would both be useful. That being said Mob Justice is the better card.

Sure, this targets creatures and players, but you have to choose a creature type and it costs 4 mana. For 4 mana in red you can do much better than this. Mob Justice costs half and doesn't care about the creature type. In practice MJ can do a fair amount of justice, especially if you imprint it on an Isochron Scepter and throw some token generators out there.

Posted By: themicronaut (10/11/2012 3:09:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Of course, [Mob Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mob Justice) doesn't count noncreature permanents, which was the whole point of printing it in the block which introduced tribal noncreatures (Future Sight doesn't count). Also, Mob Justice can't target creatures. For example, decks using [Boggart Shenanigans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Shenanigans) would love this as a finisher.
posts.html:
Of course, Mob Justice doesn't count noncreature permanents, which was the whole point of printing it in the block which introduced tribal noncreatures (Future Sight doesn't count). Also, Mob Justice can't target creatures. For example, decks using Boggart Shenanigans would love this as a finisher.
